bio.p1: I'm Ian, a meticulous front-end engineer based in BC, building sleek, high-performance websites, custom CMS platforms, and dynamic web apps powered by modern JavaScript and React.

p2.part1: I thrive at the intersection of code, design, and logic. With a Bachelor of Science in
p2.part2: from UBC and a top-of-class finish at BCIT’s
p2.part3: program, I’ve spent the past decade transforming complex ideas into clean, intuitive digital experiences.

p3.part1: While development is my main focus, I’ve always had one foot in the design world. I’m experienced with Photoshop and enjoy contributing to UI and UX decisions to help projects look as good as they work. Outside the code editor, I enjoy playing piano and

sfu.description: Sole front-end specialist within SFU’s central IT Services team, leading all front-end development and providing technical support across the university’s web application ecosystem. Responsible for building and maintaining SFU’s custom web applications — including its Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) content management systems — used daily by thousands of faculty and staff to create and manage their own department and faculty websites.
sfu.footnote: Public research university in British Columbia

signals.description: Collaborated on diverse projects for clients including UBC, Clear Seas, Foundry, BCNU, Crofton House, MYM, and the Graham Boeckh Foundation. Independently designed and developed a custom team, project, and budget management web application, integrating multiple APIs. The platform was widely adopted by internal managers and accountants for daily operations.

shoes.description: Worked closely with designers, project managers, marketers, and developers to build responsive UI features and webpages for the company’s e-commerce platforms across multiple environments. Followed modern development workflows, including task automation with Grunt and Gulp, version control with Git, and A/B testing using Maxymiser.

ubc.name: University of British Columbia
ubc.degree: Bachelor of Science, Computer Science and Statistics

bio_closing.part1: I bring a critical eye and strong attention to detail to every project, aiming to strike the right balance between function and form. For me, great web development means more than clean code — it’s about creating modern, visually polished, and intuitive experiences that actually feel good to use. I'm always on the lookout for interesting projects with awesome people. Got something in mind? Free free to

sfu.title: Simon Fraser University
sfu.description: A large-scale AEM platform empowering thousands of faculty and staff to easily create and manage their own websites.

foundry.title: Foundry BC
foundry.description: A comprehensive WordPress site guiding BC youth and young adults to discover essential services and resources.

clearseas-oil-spills.title: Clear Seas
clearseas-oil-spills.description: One of six bilingual microsites crafted for Clear Seas, each featuring fully custom WordPress themes.

ubc-med-pathways.title: UBC Med Pathways
ubc-med-pathways.description: A digital magazine for the UBC School of Medicine, showcasing multiple issues with a variety of custom interactive components.

gbf.title: Graham Boeckh Foundation
gbf.description: A bilingual WordPress site for a private foundation, incorporating multiple tailor-made components.

bcnu.title: BCNU Annual Report
bcnu.description: A brochure-style WordPress site for the BC Nurses' Union, built from a fully custom theme designed from scratch.

underwater-noise.title: Underwater Noise
underwater-noise.description: Another of the six bilingual microsites built for Clear Seas, featuring bespoke WordPress themes.
